Dizzy Heights is the fourth studio album by British alternative rock band
The Lightning Seeds, released in 1996, and reached No. 11 in the UK Albums
Chart. It was re-issued in Sony Mid Price range in August 1999.

Dizzy Heights was recorded at the Eel Pie Island studio, a barge on the
River Thames Ian Broudie had rented from Pete Townshend of The Who. Work
on the album was halted midway through 1996 so Broudie could concentrate
on Three Lions, which the Football Association had approached him to write
in time for Euro 96.

According to Broudie, the album was recorded in two 'sections' Ã¢â‚¬â€œ one with
the band utilising live drums and bass guitar, the other using loops and
samplers produced by Broudie
